ltdrdata/ComfyUI-Manager: ComfyUI-Manager is an extension that enhances ComfyUI usability by allowing users to manage custom nodes through installation, removal, enabling, and disabling functions. It also features a hub for accessing comprehensive information about various nodes within ComfyUI.
ltdrdata/ComfyUI-Impact-Pack: The ComfyUI-Impact-Pack is a custom node pack designed to enhance images using various tools like Detector, Detailer, and Upscaler. It requires ComfyUI version 0.3.63 or higher and includes compatibility updates for various models and features, while also noting the need for separate installation of certain nodes.
ltdrdata/ComfyUI-Impact-Subpack: The ComfyUI-Impact-Subpack enhances the ComfyUI Impact Pack by providing nodes like UltralyticsDetectorProvider for loading Ultralytics models, including SEGMDETECTOR and BBOXDETECTOR. It allows users to download various detection models through ComfyUI-Manager, ensuring safe model loading configurations.
ltdrdata/ComfyUI-Inspire-Pack: The ComfyUI-Inspire-Pack provides various extension nodes for ComfyUI, including the Lora Block Weight node, which applies block weight vectors to LoRA models using parameters R, A, B, a, and b. This functionality enhances model efficiency and requires specific version updates for compatibility.
ltdrdata/comfyui-connection-helper: The ComfyUI Connection Helper is an extension that simplifies node connections by providing three mouse-click functionalities: connecting outputs to empty inputs, duplicating input connections based on slot names, and duplicating all connections when inputs and outputs are empty.
ltdrdata/was-node-suite-comfyui: The WAS Node Suite Revised for ComfyUI offers an extensive collection of nodes for image and text processing, including features like BLIP model loading and analysis, SAM segmentation, and various image manipulation tools. It also includes organizational nodes like the Bus Node and Cache Node to streamline workflows.
comfyanonymous/ComfyUI_experiments: The ComfyUI custom nodes include functionalities for tonemapping noise in ModelSampler, implementing Rescale Classifier-Free Guidance for model merging, and merging SDXL base models. Additionally, the referenceonly node allows for controlnet implementation, enhancing image processing capabilities.
comfyanonymous/ComfyUI_TensorRT: The TensorRT Node for ComfyUI optimizes AI model performance on NVIDIA RTX GPUs for various Stable Diffusion versions by generating dynamic or static TensorRT engines tailored to specific resolutions and batch sizes, enhancing computational efficiency. It requires specific VRAM capacities depending on the model used.
Comfy-Org/NIMnodes: The NVIDIA NIM node in ComfyUI enables optimal execution of various models from Black Forest Lab and experimental support for Stability AI models on NVIDIA GPUs with 32GB VRAM or more. It automates NIM setup and requires a Hugging Face API token for model access.
Stability-AI/ComfyUI-SAI_API: The Stability API nodes for ComfyUI enable integration with various Stable Image routes, including features for upscaling, inpainting, and background manipulation. Users can configure their API key through environment variables, files, or directly in node fields, with a focus on secure workflow sharing.
Stability-AI/stability-ComfyUI-nodes: The ControlLoraSave custom node for ComfyUI generates a Control Lora by calculating the difference between model weights and controlnet weights, storing this difference in Lora format. It is located in the stability section of the custom nodes.
Fannovel16/comfyui_controlnet_aux: The ComfyUI ControlNet Auxiliary Preprocessors node facilitates the creation of anime-style hint images and various lineart types, integrating multiple preprocessors for efficient use. It supports features like plug-and-play installation via ComfyUI Manager and allows for quick access to preprocessor functionalities, though threshold parameters must be set directly in their respective nodes.
Fannovel16/ComfyUI-Frame-Interpolation: The ComfyUI Frame Interpolation node set enables video frame interpolation with improved memory management, reducing RAM and VRAM usage. It supports various interpolation methods, requires a minimum number of frames for processing, and offers compatibility with non-CUDA devices through an experimental backend.
Fannovel16/ComfyUI-MotionDiff: ComfyUI MotionDiff integrates various motion modeling techniques (4DHuman, MotionGPT, MDM, MotionDiffuse, ReMoDiffuse) into ComfyUI, enabling 3D pose estimation and rendering with options for pseudo-openpose and real openpose outputs. It supports customizable parameters for frame generation and optimization during motion data conversion to SMPL models.
Fannovel16/ComfyUI-Video-Matting: This ComfyUI custom node implements Robust Video Matting (RVM) and BRAIAI-RVMBG v1.4, enabling efficient background removal and video matting. It provides a streamlined workflow for integrating advanced video processing capabilities within the ComfyUI environment.
Fannovel16/ComfyUI-MagickWand: The ComfyUI MagickWand node integrates ImageMagick for advanced image editing and manipulation within ComfyUI, supporting batch processing and a variety of effects such as blur, sharpen, and emboss. It requires ImageMagick installation on the user's system for functionality.
time-river/ComfyUI-CLIPSeg: The ComfyUI custom nodes CLIPSeg and CombineSegMasks enable image inpainting by generating binary masks from text prompts and combining multiple masks for enhanced area coverage. Key features include adjustable Gaussian blur, thresholding, dilation, and the ability to overlay heatmaps and binary masks on the input image.
BlenderNeko/ComfyUI_Cutoff: The ComfyUI Cutoff node allows users to limit the influence of specific attributes in prompts by isolating token embeddings, enabling precise control over how attributes like colors apply to designated nouns. It includes nodes for setting base prompts and defining regions of influence for targeted words.
BlenderNeko/ComfyUI_ADV_CLIP_emb: The Advanced CLIP Text Encode node for ComfyUI enhances prompt weighting control with two main settings: token normalization (options include none, mean, length, and length mean) and weight interpretation (options include comfy, A1111, compel, and downweight). These features allow for precise adjustments in how token weights are processed and interpreted.
BlenderNeko/ComfyUI_Noise: The ComfyUI Noise repo includes six nodes that enhance noise control in image generation workflows, allowing for variations and noise matching with input images. Key features include generating noise with customizable settings, duplicating samples in batches, mixing latents, and calculating expected noise levels for samplers.
BlenderNeko/ComfyUI_TiledKSampler: The Tiled Sampling node for ComfyUI enables denoising of larger images by dividing them into smaller tiles, minimizing seams through gradual denoising and randomized tile positions. It offers multiple tiling strategies, including random, random strict, and padded, each with distinct features and compatibility considerations.
BlenderNeko/ComfyUI_SeeCoder: The ComfyUI SeeCoder nodes include SEECoderImageEncode for creating embeddings from images and ConcatConditioning for concatenating multiple embeddings, such as text and visual embeddings. These experimental nodes enhance the functionality of ComfyUI by enabling advanced embedding manipulation.
jags111/efficiency-nodes-comfyui: The ComfyUI Efficiency Nodes collection streamlines workflows by reducing node count and enhancing functionality, featuring custom loaders for various model types, advanced KSampler options with live previews, and script nodes for executing pre-defined actions. It supports cache settings, prompt encoding, and integrates with XY Plot for data visualization.
jags111/ComfyUI_Jags_VectorMagic: ComfyUIJagsVectorMagic is a collection of nodes for vector and image manipulation, featuring K sampler and circular VAE modes for tileable images, and segmentation using Ultralytics Yolov8 models. Key nodes include CLIPSeg for binary mask generation from images and text prompts, and JagsCombineSegMasks for combining multiple masks into one.
jags111/ComfyUI_Jags_Audiotools: ComfyUIJagsAudiotools is a collection of audio tools for ComfyUI, enabling users to generate and play audio files. It includes features like a sample generator for trained models, a wave generator, and a wrapper for VST3 plugins, with ongoing updates and improvements.
Derfuu/Derfuu_ComfyUI_ModdedNodes: DerfuuComfyUIModdedNodes is a ComfyUI custom node that automates calculations based on image sizes, facilitates editing multiple node values, and includes features like string manipulation, random value generation, and type conversion. It also provides a debug output node for visualizing variable types and supports dynamic prompts.
paulo-coronado/comfy_clip_blip_node: The ComfyUI custom node integrates BLIP into CLIPTextEncode, allowing users to embed text from images by connecting the node and specifying minlength and maxlength parameters. It supports optional embedding of BLIP text in prompts and requires specific dependencies for installation.
WASasquatch/ComfyUI_Preset_Merger: The ComfyUIPresetMerger node merges checkpoint models based on preset configurations, featuring a Sine example for integration. However, it currently lacks sawtooth examples.
WASasquatch/PPF_Noise_ComfyUI: The Perlin Power Fractal Noise node for ComfyUI generates a batch of images with a Perlin power fractal effect, allowing customization of tensor count, dimensions, and various resampling methods for scaling noise. It is a deprecated predecessor to the PowerNoiseSuite.
WASasquatch/PowerNoiseSuite: The Power Noise Suite for ComfyUI enhances latent noise input and diffusion with nodes like Perlin Power Fractal Noise and Power KSampler, featuring advanced resampling methods for noise generation and a tonal guide image for thematic generation alignment with input images.
WASasquatch/FreeU_Advanced: The FreeU Advanced Plus and Post-CFG SHIFT node in ComfyUI allows users to manipulate model outputs through customizable scaling, blending modes, and Fourier transform adjustments. It enhances image generation by blending denoised tensors with scaled versions, offering fine control over parameters like strength and thresholds.
WASasquatch/WAS_Extras: WASExtras includes various experimental nodes for ComfyUI, such as VAEEncode for encoding images to latent metadata, CameraMotionTrajectory for generating animated camera paths from images, ConditioningBlend for blending prompts with various algorithms, and DebugThis for inspecting workflow inputs and structures.
WASasquatch/face-upscaling-and-seamless-: FUSE is a ComfyUI custom node that enhances face images by integrating YOLO face detection and SAM segmentation for precise masking and seamless upscaling. Key features include intelligent face detection, adjustable cropping, multiple blending modes, color preservation options, and an internal caching system for improved workflow efficiency.
WASasquatch/was_affine: AFFINE is a ComfyUI node suite that enhances diffusion results during sampling by applying adaptive field filtering in latent space. It features controlled scale and bias transformations, modular options for granular parameter control, integrated samplers, and pattern noise generation, improving detail, contrast, and overall image quality.
WASasquatch/ComfyUI_LMStudio_EasyQuery: The WAS LM Studio Easy-Query custom node pack integrates LM Studio's Python SDK with ComfyUI, enabling local LLM and VLM workflows. It features model configuration, customizable query options, text vision querying, image captioning, and supports persistent or temporary chat conversations, with specific configuration for security and performance.
WASasquatch/ComfyUI_RetroArch_Player: The ComfyUI RetroArch Player node embeds the RetroArch Web Player within ComfyUI, allowing users to select cores and load content for various gaming systems like NES and PlayStation. It requires internet access and may have fullscreen limitations due to iframe restrictions.
omar92/ComfyUI-QualityOfLifeSuit_Omar92: The ComfyUI custom node package includes extra nodes for enhanced functionality, such as a ChatGPT node for generating natural language responses and various string manipulation tools. It supports image generation from text and allows for seamless integration with OpenAI's API for advanced language processing.
lilly1987/ComfyUI_node_Lilly: The ComfyUI-node-Lilly is a custom node for ComfyUI that facilitates wildcard text processing, allowing users to match and encode text patterns from various file formats. It supports multiple encodings and integrates with various sampling and loading functions, although it is no longer maintained.
sylym/comfy_vid2vid: The Vid2vid Node Suite for ComfyUI enables users to load and generate image sequences with varying styles or content. Key features include loading image and mask sequences from folders, customizable sampling parameters, and encoding sequences into latent vectors using a Variational Autoencoder (VAE).
EllangoK/ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes: ComfyUI-post-processing-nodes is a collection of nodes for ComfyUI that provide various image effects, including blending, blurring, color correction, and artistic transformations like ASCII art and pencil sketches. Key features include customizable parameters for each effect, enabling users to create visually striking images through advanced post-processing techniques.
LEv145/images-grid-comfy-plugin: The ImagesGrid ComfyUI custom node creates a configurable grid layout for displaying images, similar to the XYZPlot in auto1111, and offers enhanced settings for integration with workflows. Users can download and unpack the latest stable release to utilize this functionality.
diontimmer/ComfyUI-Vextra-Nodes: ComfyUI Vextra Nodes is a collection of custom nodes for ComfyUI that includes features like pixel sorting, color mode swapping, solid color generation, text addition to images, sound playback, prompt beautification using AI, noise generation, and color flattening. It enhances image processing and manipulation capabilities within the ComfyUI framework.
CYBERLOOM-INC/ComfyUI-nodes-hnmr: This ComfyUI custom node enhances the original functionality by providing various latent and sampling nodes, including VAE encoding/decoding, latent visualization, and model merging capabilities. It allows users to efficiently manage and manipulate latent tensors and model states, ensuring seamless integration and usability within the ComfyUI framework.
BadCafeCode/masquerade-nodes-comfyui: The Masquerade Nodes pack for ComfyUI focuses on mask creation and manipulation, featuring the Mask by Text node that utilizes ClipSeg to generate dynamic masks from images based on text prompts. It allows for fine control over image composition, inpainting, and filtering, optimizing workflows without dependencies.
Jcd1230/rembg-comfyui-node: The Rembg Background Removal Node for ComfyUI enables users to efficiently remove backgrounds from images using the rembg algorithm, with installation options based on GPU support. It integrates seamlessly into ComfyUI, enhancing image processing capabilities.
trojblue/trNodes: The ComfyUI custom node module includes features for image layering with transparency, color correction based on a reference image, and a batch router for improved workflow. It enhances image processing capabilities by allowing blending and adjustment of multiple images efficiently.
szhublox/ambw_comfyui: The Auto-MBW node for ComfyUI merges two models by evaluating various block ratios, automatically selecting the highest-rated merge based on a classifier's feedback. It features customizable settings for sample generation, search depth for ratio testing, and utilizes classifiers from the sdweb-auto-MBW repository.
city96/ComfyUI_NetDist: ComfyUINetDist enables the execution of ComfyUI workflows across multiple local GPUs on networked machines, facilitating dual-GPU setups and advanced configurations. It supports batch size adjustments, remote control, and image fetching from secondary instances, enhancing scalability and flexibility in processing.
city96/SD-Latent-Interposer: The SD-Latent-Interposer is a custom ComfyUI node that enables interoperability between latents from different Stable Diffusion models, specifically allowing SDXL latents to be used in SDv1.5 models without VAE decoding. It supports local model usage and requires specific setup for optimal performance.
city96/SD-Latent-Upscaler: The SD-Latent-Upscaler is a ComfyUI custom node designed to upscale stable diffusion latents using a small neural network, functioning similarly to ESRGAN but less trained. It allows for chaining multiple upscalers for higher scale factors and can operate offline by loading local model files.
city96/ComfyUI_ColorMod: This ComfyUI custom node pack focuses on image color manipulation, HDR processing, and tonemapping, featuring visualization tools for color adjustments. It includes nodes for remapping color values and requires careful testing for optimal results, especially with HDR images to avoid artifacts.
city96/ComfyUI_ExtraModels: The Extra Models for ComfyUI repository enhances ComfyUI by adding support for various image diffusion models, including multiple resolutions and a compressed latent space. It utilizes the Gemma2 2B text encoder and provides automatic model downloading through the Gemma Loader node, optimizing memory usage with 4-bit quantization.
city96/ComfyUI-GGUF: The ComfyUI-GGUF custom node enables support for GGUF format models, facilitating quantization for efficient operation on low-end GPUs. It includes a GGUF Unet loader and experimental LoRA loading, optimizing VRAM usage with quantized T5 text encoder integration while requiring a compatible ComfyUI version for installation.
SLAPaper/ComfyUI-Image-Selector: ComfyUI-Image-Selector is a custom node that allows users to select specific images from a batch for further processing, such as scaling or saving. It supports range selection and outputs only the chosen images based on specified indexes, enhancing batch image management in ComfyUI.
SLAPaper/StableDiffusion-dpmpp_2m_alt-Sa: The DPM 2M Alt Sampler for ComfyUI and WebUI implements the DPM 2M SDE sampler by hallatore, featuring an Exponential Bonus Align Your Steps Scheduler, currently available only in WebUI. It enhances sampling efficiency and is recommended for use with the latest development version.
flyingshutter/As_ComfyUI_CustomNodes: The ComfyUI custom nodes serve as a testing platform for ComfyUI, designed to minimize external dependencies. They are experimental and may not guarantee functionality.
Zuellni/ComfyUI-Custom-Nodes: The ComfyUI custom node repository includes aesthetic and IF nodes for model loading, prompt encoding, and image upscaling. Key features include automatic model downloads, aesthetic style tensor selection, and multiple stages of image processing, although the repository is archived and no longer maintained.
Zuellni/ComfyUI-ExLlama-Nodes: The ComfyUI ExLlama Nodes provide a local text generation solution using ExLlamaV2, supporting EXL2, 4-bit GPTQ, and FP16 models. Key features include model loading, text formatting, tokenization, VRAM management options, and customizable generation settings for efficient text output.
Zuellni/ComfyUI-PickScore-Nodes: The ComfyUI PickScore Nodes facilitate image scoring by predicting which images in a batch best match a specified prompt. Key features include a Loader for scoring models, a Processor for input conversion, and a Selector that filters images while managing processing interruptions.
AlekPet/ComfyUI_Custom_Nodes_AlekPet: The ComfyUI custom nodes enhance functionality by providing various translation and image processing capabilities, including pose control, sketching, and multiple translation modules using Google, Deep Translator, Argos, and AI-based methods, allowing for both text and conditioning outputs.
pythongosssss/ComfyUI-WD14-Tagger: The ComfyUI WD 1.4 Tagger is an extension for interrogating booru tags from images, supporting multiple batched inputs and automatic model downloads. Key features include customizable tag thresholds, exclusion options, and quick interrogation via right-click on image nodes.
pythongosssss/ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts: ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts enhances ComfyUI with features like custom word autocomplete, auto-arranging graphs, and improved node management, including custom loaders with preview images. It also offers image resizing, a custom color picker, and an examples widget for sample prompts, streamlining user experience and functionality.
strimmlarn/ComfyUI-Strimmlarns-Aesthetic: The ComfyUI-Strimmlarns-Aesthetic-Score node evaluates images using an aesthetic scoring model, allowing users to calculate and sort images based on their aesthetic scores. It includes features for converting scores to numerical values and supports image pairing for optimal output.
TinyTerra/ComfyUI_tinyterraNodes: tinyterraNodes is a collection of custom nodes for ComfyUI that enhances image viewing with features like a fullscreen image viewer, slideshow mode, and customizable shortcuts. It allows users to manage and navigate generated images efficiently, including setting default fullscreen nodes and toggling overlays.
Jordach/comfy-plasma: The comfy-plasma node generates fractal diamond square noise clouds, allowing users to customize image size, turbulence, and color channel intensity with min-max limits. It features seed options for consistent or variable noise generation across executions.
bvhari/ComfyUI_ImageProcessing: The ComfyUI ImageProcessing custom node utilizes Kornia to implement various image processing techniques, enabling advanced manipulation and enhancement of images within the ComfyUI framework.
bvhari/ComfyUI_PerpWeight: The ComfyUI PerpWeight node implements a novel weighting scheme for CLIP token vectors, enabling a broader range of weight values. It is inspired by the Perp-Neg method, enhancing flexibility in token representation.
bvhari/ComfyUI_SUNoise: The ComfyUI SUNoise node generates scaled uniform noise for ancestral stochastic samplers, enhancing noisy latent images. Version 2.0.0 introduces interleaved SUNoise with standard Gaussian noise, improving output quality, with a recommendation of 30 steps or more for optimal results.
bvhari/ComfyUI_PerpCFG: The ComfyUI PerpCFG node addresses oversaturation issues in image generation by implementing a perpendicular CFG approach, particularly effective at high guidance scale values. It suggests using a cosine schedule for optimal CFG scale management.
ssitu/ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale: The ComfyUIUltimateSDUpscale node enhances image-to-image diffusion for large images by processing them in tiles, improving detail while minimizing hardware demands. It maintains compatibility with the diffusion model's trained image size and offers installation via Git or manual download.
ssitu/ComfyUI_restart_sampling: The ComfyUIrestartsampling node implements restart sampling techniques to enhance generative processes, featuring KSampler variants that allow configuration of restart segments and scheduling. It includes options for standard, simple, and advanced samplers, with specific handling for ODE samplers and segment validation.
ssitu/ComfyUI_roop: The ComfyUI roop nodes enable face-swapping functionality in images, derived from the A1111 web UI script. Key features include two nodes: "roop" for basic face swapping and "RoopImproved" for enhanced control, along with built-in ethical safeguards against misuse.
ssitu/ComfyUI_fabric: The ComfyUI FABRIC custom nodes enable the personalization of diffusion models through iterative feedback, allowing users to patch models for various samplers and manage latents effectively. Key features include advanced input options for positive and negative latents, facilitating nuanced control over image generation characteristics.
space-nuko/ComfyUI-Disco-Diffusion: The ComfyUI Disco Diffusion node enables modularized image generation using Guided Diffusion and OpenAI CLIP models, with automatic model downloading and caching. It features a unique prompt syntax for step-based generation, allowing for longer prompts and customizable weights, enhancing the creative control in the diffusion process.
space-nuko/ComfyUI-OpenPose-Editor: The OpenPose Editor for ComfyUI allows users to import and create new poses as nodes, with all modifications saved to ComfyUI's input folder, enhancing pose management for stable diffusion workflows.
space-nuko/nui-suite: The nui-suite custom nodes for ComfyUI include a Dynamic Prompts Text Encode for CLIP text encoding, a Feeling Lucky Text Encode for prompt searching with Dynamic Prompts support, and an Output String node for sending strings from backend to frontend for prompt inspection.
melMass/comfy_oiio: The OpenImageIO custom node for ComfyUI provides basic I/O operations with comprehensive colorspace support, enabling image loading, conversion, and saving across various formats. It includes a colorspace converter and basic metadata handling, facilitating proper color management in image processing workflows.
xXAdonesXx/NodeGPT: NodeGPT is a ComfyUI custom node that implements AutoGen for automated multi-agent chat and task-solving with code generation and execution. It features debugging capabilities and supports complex task solving through group chat, though it is still under development with some functionalities not fully operational.
ciri/comfyui-model-downloader: The Model Downloader for ComfyUI simplifies downloading and managing machine learning models within the ComfyUI environment, supporting repositories like Hugging Face and CivitAI. Key features include user-friendly model downloading, an auto model finder for known files, and options for file management such as overwriting existing files.
Suzie1/ComfyUI_Comfyroll_CustomNodes: Comfyroll Studio is a custom node for ComfyUI that enhances image processing capabilities, featuring nodes for prompt management, model selection, and advanced image manipulation. Key features include batch processing, LoRA integration, and ControlNet support, facilitating complex workflows and customization in image generation tasks.
bmad4ever/ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo: The Bmad's Dirty Undo-Redo extension for ComfyUI provides undo and redo functionality, allowing users to revert or reapply actions using keyboard shortcuts. However, as of November 28, 2023, this extension is obsolete due to the integration of similar features in the updated ComfyUI.
bmad4ever/comfyui_ab_samplercustom: The comfyuiabsampler is an experimental sampler node that alternates sampling between A and B inputs, utilizing a 2x2 grid for B steps. It optionally incorporates a mask to copy regions outside the defined ROI from the original latent at each step, though its applications are considered niche.
bmad4ever/comfyui_lists_cartesian_produc: The Lists Cartesian Product node in ComfyUI generates all possible permutations from a set of input lists, allowing for comprehensive argument combinations for subsequent nodes. Users can update input and output slots by right-clicking the node and selecting the update option.
bmad4ever/comfyui_wfc_like: The ComfyUI custom node "comfyuiwfclike" implements a modified Wave Function Collapse algorithm, focusing on local constraints inferred from sample images without maintaining a full wave grid. It employs a greedy search with backtracking to efficiently generate partially complete states, suitable for visual applications.
bmad4ever/comfyui_quilting: The ComfyUI quilting node facilitates image and latent quilting using texture synthesis techniques, allowing for automatic block size estimation and parallelized texture generation. Key features include patch blending, seamless texture conversion, and adjustable block size settings to optimize synthesis time and texture continuity.
bmad4ever/comfyui_panels: ComfyUI Panels provides nodes for creating and organizing comic or manga panels through hierarchical panel layouts. It allows for customizable cuts, orientations, and the saving of unique layouts, while defining relative spacing and visual grouping without storing specific panel properties.
FizzleDorf/ComfyUI_FizzNodes: FizzNodes is a ComfyUI custom node set that enables scheduled prompts, float int values, and wave function nodes for animations, particularly for audio-synced animations. It includes tools for creating animations with minimal memory usage and provides resources for installation and usage.
FizzleDorf/ComfyUI-AIT: ComfyUI-AIT is a custom node that integrates Meta's AITemplate for accelerated inference using C++ and CUDA, providing a stable foundation for AIT functionality. It supports module compilation for NVIDIA GPUs and allows users to easily incorporate AITUnetLoader into their workflows for enhanced performance.
filipemeneses/comfy_pixelization: The ComfyUI pixelization node pixelizes images by utilizing three specific models (pixelartvgg19.pth, aliasnet.pth, 160netGA.pth) for image processing. Users must clone the repository and place the models in the designated directory to generate pixelated images effectively.
shiimizu/ComfyUI_smZNodes: The smZNodes for ComfyUI includes a CLIP Text Encode node that generates consistent embeddings from stable-diffusion-webui, enabling reproducible image generation. Key features include prompt editing, weight normalization, and support for multiple prompts with adjustable weights, facilitating precise control over image outputs.
shiimizu/ComfyUI-TiledDiffusion: The Tiled Diffusion VAE for ComfyUI enhances large image generation by utilizing advanced techniques like Tiled Diffusion and Tiled Noise Inversion, supporting various models and features such as ControlNet and Img2img upscale. It optimizes VRAM usage with configurable tiling strategies and batch processing options.
shiimizu/ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-Plus: The ComfyUI PhotoMaker Plus node enhances photo generation with improved face resemblance, customizable trigger words, and support for multiple prompts. It integrates seamlessly with ComfyUI, ensuring memory efficiency and compatibility with updates, while also offering additional nodes for advanced functionality.
shiimizu/ComfyUI-semantic-aware-guidance: The Semantic-aware Guidance S-CFG ComfyUI node dynamically adjusts CFG guidance levels based on semantic regions to enhance image-text alignment, particularly for models with a U-Net backbone. It is computationally intensive, may cause out-of-memory issues at large resolutions, and only allows one active instance at a time.
ZaneA/ComfyUI-ImageReward: The ComfyUI-ImageReward node scores images using the ImageReward model, which is automatically downloaded on first use. Users can connect the model, image, and prompt, with options to input prompts directly or convert them to inputs via a right-click.
SeargeDP/SeargeSDXL: Searge-SDXL EVOLVED v4.x for ComfyUI is a custom node extension that integrates a unified workflow for SDXL 1.0, supporting base and refiner checkpoints across text-to-image, image-to-image, and inpainting modes. It simplifies installation and updating processes while consolidating multiple tasks into a single workflow file.
SeargeDP/ComfyUI_Searge_LLM: The Searge-LLM node for ComfyUI enhances text-to-image prompts by generating more detailed and improved versions using a language model. Key features include adjustable token limits, customizable instructions, and support for specific model directories, requiring manual installation of the llama-cpp package for optimal functionality.
cubiq/ComfyUI_IPAdapter_plus: The ComfyUI IPAdapter enables powerful image-to-image conditioning by transferring the subject or style of a reference image to a generated output, functioning similarly to a one-image LoRA. It includes a unified model loader and various workflows for utilizing its features, although the repository is now in maintenance mode.
cubiq/ComfyUI_InstantID: The ComfyUI InstantID Native Support node provides native integration of InstantID within ComfyUI, allowing for enhanced image generation without using diffusers. Key features include support for simplified Chinese, customizable workflows, and the ability to mitigate watermark issues through resolution adjustments and noise injection.
cubiq/ComfyUI_FaceAnalysis: The Face Analysis node for ComfyUI utilizes DLib or InsightFace to analyze human faces, primarily calculating similarity between faces. Users can compare a batch of reference images against a target image to establish a baseline for evaluating generated faces.
cubiq/PuLID_ComfyUI: The PuLID ComfyUI node implements a native version of the PuLID model, utilizing a 4-step lighting UNet for image processing. Key features include adjustable weights for reference image fidelity, compatibility with IPAdapter, and the ability to experiment with CFG and various samplers for quality optimization.
cubiq/Block_Patcher_ComfyUI: The Flux blocks patcher sampler is an advanced ComfyUI custom node that allows users to iteratively adjust the weights of Flux model blocks and visualize the impact on output images. It supports complex regex for targeting specific blocks and offers potential future enhancements for speed, model compatibility, and user interface improvements.
shockz0rz/comfy-easy-grids: Easy Grids for ComfyUI is a set of custom nodes designed for generating image grids, sequences, and batches. Key features include creating and saving image grids with customizable labels, and various list nodes for managing numbers and strings, enhancing flexibility in prompt generation and image processing.
yolanother/DTAIComfyPromptAgent: The Comfy UI Prompt Agent is a custom node for the Comfy UI stable diffusion client that enhances prompt management. It requires additional Python dependencies and is installed by importing it into the custom nodes directory.
yolanother/DTAIImageToTextNode: The Image to Text Node for ComfyUI converts images into text, enhancing functionality with variable nodes and shared global variables for improved user experience. It is an optional add-on that integrates into the Comfy UI stable diffusion client.
yolanother/DTAIComfyLoaders: The ComfyUI Online Loaders are a set of custom nodes that utilize a shared online data source for loading, enhancing the Comfy UI stable diffusion client with variable nodes and global variables for improved functionality.
yolanother/DTAIComfyImageSubmit: The Comfy AI DoubTech.ai Image Submission Node allows users to upload images to DoubTech.ai, enhancing the Comfy UI stable diffusion client with variable nodes and shared global variables for improved functionality. It requires additional Python dependencies for operation.
yolanother/DTAIComfyQRCodes: The ComfyUI QR Codes script adds QR code nodes to the Comfy UI stable diffusion client, allowing users to generate QR codes. It requires additional Python dependencies and can be integrated by importing it into the custom nodes directory.
yolanother/DTAIComfyVariables: The "Variables for Comfy UI" script enhances the Comfy UI stable diffusion client by introducing variable nodes and shared global variables, improving usability and functionality. It is an optional add-on that requires import into the custom nodes directory.
yolanother/ComfyUI-Save16bitPng: The "Save Uncompressed 16 Bit PNG" custom node for ComfyUI allows users to save images as uncompressed ARGB16 PNG files, embedding metadata such as prompts and additional info. It supports dynamic filename prefixes and outputs a UI-compatible dictionary with details about the saved images.
sipherxyz/comfyui-art-venture: ArtVenture Custom Nodes for ComfyUI provides a suite of utilities for image processing, JSON manipulation, and model operations. Key features include loading images and JSON from URLs, converting strings to numbers, randomizing text, and preparing images for inpainting, enhancing workflow efficiency.
SOELexicon/ComfyUI-LexMSDBNodes: The MSSQL Interaction Utility is a Python-based tool for interacting with MSSQL servers, enabling CRUD operations and dynamic querying based on table metadata. Key features include modular design, automatic input generation from column types, and compatibility with libraries like PyODBC and NumPy for enhanced data management.
pants007/comfy-pants: The ComfyUI custom nodes in the comfy-pants repository include a "Make Square Node" for padding images to a square shape with customizable filling strategies, and a "TextEncodeAIO" node aimed at integrating StylePile-like functionality into ClipTextEncode.
evanspearman/ComfyMath: ComfyMath is a custom node for ComfyUI that offers various mathematical operations, including Boolean logic, integer and floating-point arithmetic, and vector arithmetic for Vec2, Vec3, and Vec4. It enhances ComfyUI's functionality by integrating advanced mathematical computations.
civitai/civitai_comfy_nodes: The Civitai Comfy Nodes streamline the process of downloading and managing AI models, LoRAs, and resources by allowing direct loading from Civitai, automatically detecting required resources upon image upload, and ensuring reproducible workflows through shared metadata. Key features include Checkpoint Loader, LoRA Loader, and upcoming Embedding Loader for textual inversions.
andersxa/comfyui-PromptAttention: The ComfyUI CLIP Directional Prompt Attention node enhances prompt processing by utilizing attention masks to isolate contextual influences in prompts, preventing irrelevant parts from affecting later tokens. However, its effectiveness is limited due to model finetuning issues and its exclusive impact on the CLIP framework.
SipherAGI/comfyui-animatediff: AnimateDiff for ComfyUI integrates animatediff capabilities, allowing users to generate GIFs with a sliding window feature for frame batching. It supports Motion LoRA for enhanced animation and includes nodes for loading, sampling, and combining GIF frames, with options for custom settings and video format compatibility.
twri/sdxl_prompt_styler: The SDXL Prompt Styler is a ComfyUI custom node that styles prompts using predefined JSON templates, allowing for dynamic replacement of prompt placeholders with positive text and flexible management of negative prompts. It includes features like toggles for sentiment styling and options for handling duplicate tokens.
wolfden/ComfyUi_PromptStylers: The SDXL Prompt Styler is a ComfyUI custom node that styles prompts using predefined templates from a JSON file, allowing for dynamic insertion of positive and negative text. It effectively manages negative prompts by combining user input with template defaults, enhancing prompt customization flexibility.
wolfden/ComfyUi_String_Function_Tree: The ComfyUI String Function Tree SDXL Prompt Styler is a custom node that enhances the original String Function from ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts, allowing for additional functionalities. Users can install it via terminal commands, and it integrates into the ComfyUI workflow under a new utils submenu.
nicofdga/DZ-FaceDetailer: DZ FaceDetailer is a ComfyUI custom node that utilizes Mediapipe and YOLOv8n for face detection, enabling mask generation for multiple faces. It supports face manipulation tasks such as generating new faces and face replacement using Stable Diffusion AI.
asagi4/comfyui-prompt-control: The ComfyUI Prompt Control node enables advanced text prompt manipulation, including LoRA loading and scheduling, regional prompting, and dynamic graph generation. It features enhanced text encoding, prompt masking, and compatibility with various models, allowing for flexible and efficient prompt management within the ComfyUI framework.
asagi4/ComfyUI-CADS: The experimental CADS node for ComfyUI implements a noise conditioning method that allows for selective noise application in image generation, affecting the scaling and distribution of added noise. It features adjustable parameters for normalization and noise scheduling, aiming to enhance variety in outputs while preserving existing unet wrapper functions.
asagi4/comfyui-utility-nodes: The MUSimpleWildcard node in ComfyUI expands wildcards, variables, and function macros, allowing for dynamic content selection and manipulation. It supports case-sensitive filtering, local variable definitions, and includes default functions, enhancing flexibility in prompt customization and seed management.
asagi4/ComfyUI-Adaptive-Guidance: The Adaptive Guidance node for ComfyUI enhances inference speed by adjusting the CFG based on cosine similarity between conditional and unconditional outputs, effectively skipping negative prompt calculations when a threshold is met. It also allows for an uncond zero CFG option, though its stability and reproducibility are uncertain.
asagi4/ComfyUI-NPNet: The ComfyUI NPNet Golden Noise node implements a basic noise model that requires pre-trained weights, allowing users to generate noise conditioned on prompts. It supports custom sampling, reshapes latents to 128x128, and can run on CPU, with options to control the reshaping process.
asagi4/comfyui-dynamic-anynode: The Dynamic AIO nodes for custom sampling in ComfyUI create an All-In-One node that integrates features from various advanced custom sampling nodes using dynamic combo inputs, streamlining the interface without unnecessary complexity. Users can instantiate specific AIO nodes and connect them to CustomSamplingAdvanced for flexible implementation.
jamesWalker55/comfyui-p2ldgan: The ComfyUI - P2LDGAN Node integrates the P2LDGAN model for extracting lineart from input images, enhancing image processing capabilities within the ComfyUI framework. Users need to download and place the checkpoint to utilize this functionality.
jamesWalker55/comfyui-various: This repository offers a collection of ComfyUI nodes organized by type, allowing users to selectively download only the nodes they need for a cleaner node list. It supports two installation methods: individual file downloads for customization or cloning the entire repository for bulk installation.
adieyal/comfyui-dynamicprompts: ComfyUI-DynamicPrompts is a custom node library for ComfyUI that enhances prompt generation with features like Random Prompts for wildcard sampling, Combinatorial Prompts for value combinations, and a neural network-based Magic Prompt for modifier suggestions. It also supports Jinja2 templates for advanced prompt writing.
kwaroran/abg-comfyui: The abg-comfyui node is an Anime Background Remover for ComfyUI, functioning similarly to the ABG extension in Automatic1111. It removes backgrounds from images by connecting the image to the Remove Image Background ABG node after installing necessary dependencies.
bash-j/mikey_nodes: The Mikey Nodes repository offers custom nodes for ComfyUI, including the "Prompt With Style" node, which enables style and LORA integration for image generation. It features wildcard support, custom style and ratio file creation, and a Mikey Sampler for efficient image processing with built-in complexity detection.
blib-la/blibla-comfyui-extensions: ComfyUI Extensions by Blibla enhances the ComfyUI experience with features like customizable render modes, dynamic node coloring, and management tools for improved productivity and collaboration. It supports individual and team use, focusing on personalization and readability within the ComfyUI environment.
Pfaeff/pfaeff-comfyui: The pfaeff-comfyui custom node facilitates SDXL pixel art workflows in ComfyUI, featuring automatic dependency installation and background removal while preserving aspect ratios. Users can easily integrate images by dragging them into the interface post-installation.
wallish77/wlsh_nodes: WLSH ComfyUI Nodes is a custom node set for ComfyUI that enhances functionality by allowing metadata manipulation for saved images, generating latent images based on pixel count and aspect ratio, and offering advanced sampling and conditioning options with various configurations for prompts.
Kosinkadink/ComfyUI-Advanced-ControlNet: The ComfyUI-Advanced-ControlNet nodes enable dynamic scheduling of ControlNet strength across timesteps and batched latents, featuring custom weights and attention masks. It supports various models and allows granular control over prompt importance and style fidelity through adjustable parameters, enhancing the customization of generated outputs.
Kosinkadink/ComfyUI-AnimateDiff-Evolved: The AnimateDiff for ComfyUI enhances AnimateDiff integration with advanced sampling options, including Evolved Sampling, and supports various node packs for improved ControlNet functionality and video processing. It allows for flexible manipulation of image latents and integrates additional preprocessors and miscellaneous nodes for enhanced user control.
Kosinkadink/ComfyUI-VideoHelperSuite: The ComfyUI-VideoHelperSuite includes nodes for video workflows, allowing users to load videos as image sequences, control frame rates, resize, and skip frames. It also supports loading image sequences and combining images into videos with optional audio, offering flexible batch processing and preview features.
Gourieff/ComfyUI-FutureWarningIgnore: The ComfyUI-FutureWarningIgnore node suppresses FutureWarning messages in the console, providing a cleaner output for users who find these warnings distracting. It is a simple utility for enhancing user experience during development.
Gourieff/ComfyUI-ReActor: The ComfyUI custom node is a face swap extension that includes a nudity detector for SFW compliance and supports HyperSwap models. Key features include adjustable face swap strength, improved gender detection, and enhanced processing speed for face restoration tasks.
imb101/ComfyUI-FaceSwap: ComfyUI-FaceSwap is a custom node for face swapping in ComfyUI, currently operating on CPU with future GPU support planned. It allows users to replace faces in images using a specified source face, with the ability to chain nodes for multiple face replacements, though results may vary due to the limited model resolution.
Chaoses-Ib/ComfyUI_Ib_CustomNodes: The "Load Image From Path" custom node for ComfyUI allows users to load images directly from a specified source path, avoiding duplication issues and enabling real-time updates when the source file changes. It features enhanced image preview, file browsing capabilities, and is particularly useful for integrating with Photoshop's Quick Export for img2img inpainting.
AIrjen/OneButtonPrompt: One Button Prompt is a ComfyUI custom node that generates AI prompts for Stable Diffusion with a single click, offering features like full prompt generation, support for various image generation modes (TXT2IMG, IMG2IMG, ControlNET), and the ability to create and save prompt variants and presets. It is designed for both beginners and advanced users seeking inspiration.
coreyryanhanson/ComfyQR: ComfyQR is a set of ComfyUI nodes designed for generating dynamic QR code layers for generative art, featuring two main nodes: QR Code and QR Code Split. It allows customization of QR code parameters such as size, error correction level, and pixel dimensions, facilitating advanced workflows without leaving the web UI.
coreyryanhanson/ComfyQR-scanning-nodes: ComfyQR-scanning-nodes is a set of ComfyUI custom nodes designed for testing QR code scannability, featuring two main functionalities: extracting text from QR codes using the pyzbar library and validating the extracted text against the original QR code link. It requires the zbar library for operation and supports advanced error handling.
dimtoneff/ComfyUI-PixelArt-Detector: The ComfyUI PixelArt Detector v1.7.3 generates, downscales, and restores pixel art images using SDXL, offering features like customizable palettes, various resizing modes, and improved workflow compatibility. It includes a preview for palette changes and maintains backward compatibility while enhancing user control over image processing.
theUpsider/ComfyUI-Styles_CSV_Loader: The Styles CSV Loader Extension for ComfyUI enables users to import styles from a CSV file, facilitating migration from the automatic1111 Stable Diffusion web UI. It supports custom CSV paths, allowing for flexible style organization and fallback to default styles if a specified style is absent.
M1kep/Comfy_KepListStuff: Comfy-KepListStuff is a collection of nodes designed for managing and utilizing list functionality within ComfyUI, enhancing the ability to manipulate and process lists effectively in workflows.
